newsitem.title: UK: Hanson sells electrical unit for to Cinven.
newsitem.headline: Hanson sells electrical unit for to Cinven.

text.p: Britain's Hanson Plc said on Monday it had sold its Hanson Electrical unit to management buyout group Cinven for at least 135 million stg.
Hanson will receive 125 million stg in cash and a 10 million stg loan note which will bear an interest of five percent and be repayable in 2006.
Hanson said Cinven would assume commitments of a further 10 million stg.
Hanson Electrical manufactures domestic circuit protection, wiring accessories and other electrical installation products. The company will change its name to Electrium following the sale.
Hanson Electrical's sales amounted to 145 million stg in the year to October 1, 1996 while its profits stood at 13.4 million during the period.
Its net assets as on March 31, 1997 stood at 58 million stg.
